exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a wide grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Offers a big stretch on your lats, provides smooth even tension throughout the range of motion, feels great, and allows for easy overload by increasing the pin weight.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets both the lats and mid traps due to the wide grip and pulling motion.
exercises.selection_reason: The Wide Grip Lat Pull Down is selected for its ability to target the lats and mid traps effectively, aligning with the user's goal of overall back definition. Its wide grip ensures a comprehensive engagement of the back muscles, making it suitable for an early intermediate level.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
exercises.execution_notes: Pull the weight towards your chest while keeping your chest against the pad, and return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Stable, allows focus on back muscles, and can be done with various equipment.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets both lats and midback due to the pulling motion.
exercises.additional_notes: Crowned as the best exercise for back development.
exercises.selection_reason: The Chest Supported Row is chosen for its stability and focus on the back muscles, which is ideal for achieving overall back definition. It allows for controlled movement, making it suitable for the user's experience level and goals.

exercises.setup_notes: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
exercises.execution_notes: Ensure full range of motion by going all the way down and maintaining high tension in the stretched position.
exercises.tier_reasons: High tension in stretched position, locks elbows to prevent cheating, significant distal biceps growth.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Distal biceps, due to high tension in stretched position.
exercises.scientific_insights: Study shows preacher curls cause more distal biceps growth compared to incline curls.
exercises.selection_reason: The Preacher Curl is selected for its ability to target the distal biceps effectively, aligning with the user's goal of achieving a peak in the biceps. Its design prevents cheating and ensures high tension, making it suitable for the user's experience level.

exercises.setup_notes: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
exercises.tier_reasons: Maximum stretch and tension on biceps, even tension throughout range.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Long head, due to high stretch and tension.
exercises.selection_reason: The Face Away Cable Curl is chosen for its ability to provide maximum stretch and tension on the biceps, which is crucial for developing the biceps peak. It offers even tension throughout the range, making it ideal for the user's goal and experience level.

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size.
Swing arms forward and backward, opening up the chest.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hands on hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Twist the torso from side to side, keeping the hips stable.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching the back (cat) and dropping the belly (cow).
Swing arms across the body and then out to the sides.
